alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Hancock and south central Penobscot Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Indian Island to near Hampden. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Old Town, Ellsworth, Bucksport, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Veazie, Dedham, Indian Island, Franklin, Glenburn, Orrington, Holden, Milford, Carmel, Eddington, Orland and Newburgh. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 174 and 206. US Highway 1 near Ellsworth. State Highway 9 between Newburgh and Aurora. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
